thread.title: 20 collapse outside soup kitchen in apparent K2 overdose
thread.title_full: 20 collapse outside soup kitchen in apparent K2 overdose - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: 20 collapse outside soup kitchen in apparent K2 overdose
text:
Thomas Colishaw, 21, Bamf Hunter, 29, and Abdur Rahim, 47, were arrested in connection with a spike in overdoses from use of the synthetic marijuana drug K2 in Tulsa. Three people have been arrested after an apparent K2 synthetic marijuana overdose at an Oklahoma soup kitchen sent at least 20 people to the hospital.
Dozens of people high on drugs collapsed outside the Iron Gate Soup Kitchen in Tulsa early Tuesday with some convulsing violently, Tulsa Fire Department spokesman Stan May told the Daily News.
"They were delirious," May said Wednesday. "It seemed to hit them pretty quick. They were confused and dazed and they went down."
6 BASIC FACTS ABOUT K2
Police and fire rescuers responded about 9 a.m. and watched as people took turns tumbling to the ground within a two-block area.
News9 At least 20 people were sent to the hospital after an apparent K2 drug overdose at an Oklahoma food kitchen, authorities said. News9 At least 20 people were sent to the hospital after an apparent K2 drug overdose at an Oklahoma food kitchen, authorities said. News9 At least 20 people were sent to the hospital after an apparent K2 drug overdose at an Oklahoma food kitchen, authorities said. Previous Next Enlarge "It started with one and then within 15 minutes, it was about eight or nine and then a couple more before they left the scene," May said.
Witnesses described the scene as something out of a zombie flick.
"It's like a freak accident," witness Tim Merkov told News 9 Oklahoma . "It's like from a horror movie or something."
At least 11 people were rushed to the hospital after the initial 911 call, authorities said. That number grew to at least 20 by early Wednesday, according to local reports.
